refnamediv.refpurpose: Read, preprocess and schedule a score from an input string.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Readscore will issue one or more score events. It can handle strings in the same conditions as the standard score, including preprocessing (carry, sort, ramp, etc). Multi-line strings are accepted, using {{ }} to enclose the string.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: Sin -- a string (in double-quotes or enclosed by {{ }}) containing one or more score events.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the readscore opcode. It uses the file readscore.csd.
Example of the readscore opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
You can use string opcodes like sprintfk to produce strings to be passed to readscore like this:
Sfil = "/Volumes/Bla/file.aif" String sprintfk {{i 2 0 %f "%s" %f %f %f %f}}, idur, Sfil, p5, p6, knorm, iskip readscore String
